page.title: Nominal Phrases - Degree Words
page.introduction: The top level of the nominal phrase is occupied by those degree words that modify the whole NP, such as just, only, and all, that were discussed and marked in the "Quantifiers and QP" section.

radioGroup.prompt: Does your language have these special words which modify the whole nominal phrase?
Where do these special degree words occur with respect to the rest of the nominal phrase?
radioGroup.radio: On either side, but not both sides at the same time
On either side, or both sides at the same time
Before it, or on both sides at the same time
After it, or on both sides at the same time
Only on both sides at the same time

radioGroup.prompt: Can all the degree words appear on either side of the rest of the nominal phrase?
radioGroup.radio: No, there are separate sets for each side

form.instruction: In the lexicon, mark those which can only occur initially with the feature DP-initial and those which can only occur finally with the feature DP-final. Do not enter either feature on any degree words which can occur on either side.
